title: Francis Leigh (MP for Oxford)
text:
Sir Francis Leigh (1579 – 1625) was an English barrister and politician who sat in the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20England">House of Commons</a> between 1597 and 1622.
Leigh was the eldest surviving son of Sir William Leigh of Newnham Regis and his wife Frances Harington, daughter of Sir <a href="James%20Harington%20%28lawyer%29">James Harington</a> of <a href="Exton%2C%20Rutland">Exton</a>. He entered <a href="Middle%20Temple">Middle Temple</a> in 1597 and in the same year was elected <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament">Member of Parliament</a> for <a href="Weymouth%20and%20Melcombe%20Regis%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Weymouth and Melcombe Regis</a>. By 1600 he was a member of the <a href="Antiquarian%20Society">Antiquarian Society</a>. In 1601 he was elected MP for <a href="Oxford%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Oxford</a>. He was knighted with the <a href="Order%20of%20the%20Bath">Order of the Bath</a> in 1603 and was a gentleman of the privy chamber to James I. He was re-elected MP for Oxford in 1604. In 1614 he became master of requests and in the same year, he was elected MP for <a href="Leicester%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Leicester</a>. He was <a href="High%20Sheriff%20of%20Warwickshire">High Sheriff of Warwickshire</a> from 1618 to 1619 and by 1621 was a <a href="Justice%20of%20the%20Peace">J.P.</a> for Warwickshire. In 1621 he was elected MP for <a href="Warwickshire%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Warwickshire</a>. 
Leigh died between 7 February 1625 when he made his will and 6 January 1626 when it was proved.
Leigh married Mary Egerton, daughter of <a href="Thomas%20Egerton%2C%201st%20Viscount%20Brackley">Thomas Egerton, 1st Viscount Brackley</a> before 1601 and had two sons and three daughters. His son <a href="Francis%20Leigh%2C%201st%20Earl%20of%20Chichester">Francis</a> became <a href="Earl%20of%20Chichester">Earl of Chichester</a>.
References.
